title: The 80s Crack Epidemic
description:
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

transcription: {"text": "A lot of the Southern cities during the nineties were hit with a crack epidemic. And one of the things I had a buddy of mine, he's going to Harvard and he's lived in both places. And he told me he believes part of the reason why some of this happened was because in the South, the, the sentences for crack cocaine were like five, 10 times worse than they were for powder cocaine. And so you saw a lot of these kids like would go to jail and get out where in the South, they'd be getting 25 years to life. And I don't know if you think that because I, during while you were alive, we had, um, hardcore closer in here. Uh, and he would, yeah, right. So Ryan Stuman was talking about this. He was like, when I was in jail is when the Bush administration got rid of that law.
